fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JIM is unable to render the values of custom fields provided by [Toolkit Plugin for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/5142/toolkit-plugin-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview].
h3. Environment

* Confluence 6.13.5
* Jira 8.1.0
* Toolkit Plugin for Jira 0.36.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Toolkit Plugin for Jira
# Add the custom fields provided by it to a project, tested *Days since last comment* and *Last public comment date*
# Add those fields in the *Collums to display* section of JIM in Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Fields values are rendered as in Jira:

 !jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Fields can be added but they don't display any value:

 !confluence-jiramacro.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

Those fields render as expected in the Filter Results gadget:

 !confluence-filter-results.png|thumbnail! 

Although the plugin that provides this functionality is unsupported, we can see that this seems to be a limitation of JIM while rendering those values. Checking the XML sent from Jira while searching for the project, we can confirm the fields and their values are included.

Another improvement would be the option of disabling the highlighting of issues in Confluence on the UI. That can be achieved by editing the plugin JAR file and finding the corresponding template you want to edit at the moment.

h3. Workaround

Use the Filter Results gadget instead of JIM if you would like to display those fields.
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro cannot display custom field values from Toolkit Plugin for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem summary

Missing Restriction Icon on the page for a user who does not have edit permission on space. The user will never know why the Edit option is missing for him and think its an issue with his instance.
h3. Scenario

Consider a scenario where space has restricted permission. The group added to space doesn't have Edit permission. Now when the users who are part of that user try to access the page, they will not see the edit option on the page. There is no way they would know that their edit access is restricted by admin at the space permission level.

Ideally, the pages should show page restriction icon for the page to avoid confusion.

For instance, for Space, the *confluence-users* group have doest have edit permission for space:

Hence the users of this group are not able to view the edit option on the page.

But the page doesn't show any restriction fo the user. Hence users don't know if the page is restricted for them to edit
h3. Suggestion

Please add a restriction icon to such pages for where the user permission is restricted at space level.
fields.summary: Missing Restriction icon on the page for a user who does not have edit permission on space

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When accessing a header/anchor on a page from a Table of Contents Macro, the header title will be either cropped by the Confluence top bar menu or hidden by the Confluence white floating banner menu.
h3. Environment

We can reproduce the issue locally on Confluence Server latest version v7.3.4 and also tried on v7.2.0 and Confluence Data Center v6.15.7.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a new page that contains:
 - a Table of contents at the top of the page
 - some headers h4: the number of sections has to be big enough so that the pages cannot be displayed in a single instance in the web browser. You have to scroll up or down to access 
 - a Table of contents at the bottom of the page
 - publish/update the page
 - Scenario1: access some of the headers section/anchors via the top ToC Macro. The header title will be cropped/not visible due to the blue/top menu banner.
 - Scenario2: access some of the headers section/anchors from the bottom ToC Macro. The header title will be hidden by the floating/white banner.

To illustrate the 2 scenarios you will find attached, a video where I show how I reproduce the issue on my *Chrome Version 80.0.3987.149 (Official Build) (64-bit)* with a local Confluence v7.3.4 Server instance. You will also find attached an example of page content in storage format (to be imported via source editor plugin) to speed-up the testing.
h3. Expected Results

When accessing a section from a Table of Contents Macro, the title of the section that is accessed should always be displayed/visible at the top of the page. We should offset the blue/top menu banner and the floating/white banner in Confluence in all cases.
h3. Actual Results

Please find the recording attached.
  
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at this stage.
fields.summary: Header titles accessed from a Table of Content Macro are not fully visible or cropped

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Plan your Upgrade" page will fail if Synchrony's node isn't properly configured. Even though the Collab. Editing my be OFF, the page will still fail to load.

(!) This error has been happening for instances that have been migrated from the standalone version to DC. We have reproduced the issue with that environment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Confluence instance 6.9.0
# Upgrade UPM and ATST
# Turn off collaborative editing
# Install Confluence DC license
# Restart Confluence and configure DC instance, don't configure anything on synchrony side
# Visit Plan your upgrade configuration page.
# Issue is visible "Looks like we're having trouble retrieving some information. Please refresh the page"
# Once Synchrony is configured correctly and Confluence is restarted the error is gone.


h3. Expected Results

The page will load when Synchrony is misconfigured but the Collab. Editing is turned off


h3. Actual Results

Although the Collab. Editing is turned off, the page checks Synchrony's configuration. As the Synchrony JVM wasn't setup after moving to DC, the below error will be logged:

{noformat}
2020-03-23 09:39:22,118 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-4] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.api.SynchronyProcessManager.isSynchronyClusterManuallyManaged()Z
 -- referer: https://confluence.example.com/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/pre-upgrade/ | url: /rest/troubleshooting/latest/pre-upgrade/info | traceId: 429c7e933d202bf2 | userName: admin
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.api.SynchronyProcessManager.isSynchronyClusterManuallyManaged()Z
	at com.atlassian.troubleshooting.confluence.pup.ConfluencePupPlatformAccessorImp.isSynchronyStandalone(
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

There are two workarounds:

* Setup Synchrony's JVM(DC) when facing the issue.
* Upgrade to Confluence 6.12(or above) and let Confluence manage Synchrony's.
fields.summary: The Plan your Upgrade page fails to load if Synchrony is misconfigured

fields.description:
Uses requested to update the release note for version 7.3 to include the note on the recent change in the 7.3 documentation related to mail resources.

While reviewing following URLS:
 * [Setting Up a Mail Session for the Confluence Distribution in version 7.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/setting-up-a-mail-session-for-the-confluence-distribution-6328.html]
 * [Setting Up a Mail Session for the Confluence Distribution in version 7.2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf72/setting-up-a-mail-session-for-the-confluence-distribution-982323710.html]

 

While configuring mail session for the Confluence 7.3, we need to move to two extra jar to the different location as describe above KB.

Name of the jars are following: 
{quote} # javax.activation-x.x.x.jar
 # javax.activation-api-1.2.0.jar{quote}
 

However this change information is not added in release notes of 7.3, so for users it is obvious to move other two jars.

If release notes contain, such change information it would be helpful for users.
fields.summary: Update 7.3 release notes

fields.description:
*Scenario*
 There are many third-party libraries used in Confluence which might be affected by some security vulnerabilities. In many of these cases, they are resolved in the later version of these libraries.
 Generally, we would have to wait for the next Confluence upgrade that will contain these updated libraries to mitigate these security risks.

*Suggestion*
 Confluence should provide the ability to upgrade third party libraries like Jquery separately i.e without the need to upgrade the Confluence itself. This would help a lot in mitigating security risks and also prevent delays in waiting for the next Confluence version containing the updated libraries.
fields.summary: Provide an ability to upgrade third party libraries like Jquery seperately from Confluence

fields.description:
Case Scenario:

 When moving a page to a different space, if the page title already exists, then the move operation will throw an error and move fails

Suggestion:
An option to rename the source page should be present on the move operation windows so that the user doesn't have to leave the workflow to rename the page.
This would require an introduction of new API to rename the page title
fields.summary: Option to rename the source page title during Move operation if a page with same title exists in another space

h3. Issue Summary
The lines for the 'Order' column in the 'User Directories' ({{plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list}}) page doesn't render properly as per the following screenshot:
 !Screenshot 2020-03-30 at 6.18.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 
(i) Notice the lines above or below the arrows are slightly offset. It is even more prominent when more directories are added.

Replicated on Confluence version 7.3.1, 7.2.2, 7.1.0 and 6.13.4 and replicable on Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to {{<confluence-url>/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list}}
# Add a new directory

h3. Expected Results
The table renders correct.

h3. Actual Results
The lines above or below the arrows are slightly offset.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: The Up and Down arrows in User Directories page aren't aligned properly

There is a workaround for 'Space Admin' to be able to search for that particular 'Restricted page', however, this is not achievable for the following scenario:
* [CONFSERVER-36393: Confluence Super User Cannot Find Restricted Page via Quick Search|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36393]

Can we provide a temporary workaround to change the number of 'item_per_page' number which has been hardcoded to 30 for the pagination?

Using $config.getBaseUrl() and 
$config.getDomainName() calls in user macros does not work in 7.x Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user maco with $config.getBaseUrl()
 # Try to click on macro,

Should pull the baseURL 

h3. Actual Results
URL will show $config.getBaseUrl() instead of actually picking up the base URL same with getdomain name

Use the hardcoded URL for the baseURL instead of the call.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Deleting user macro from a page, leaves behind some HTML tags Deleting a nested inner macro causes the first macro to display $body because of the html tags left behind. h3. Environment * Confluence Server 7.2.1 * Chrome Version 80.0.3987.149 (Official Build) (64-bit) * Server: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS Steps to Reproduce # Under the guide [Writing User Macros|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/writing-user-macros-4485.html], go to the section Example user macros" and copy the "Color and Size" # Create a user macro into your confluence as the example. # Create a blank page # Edit the new page and add the "Color and Size" macro # Publish the page # Edit the page again and create a new "Color and Size" macro inside the first macro (nested). # Publish the page # Edit the page again, delete the inner macro. # Remove the blank spaces from the first macro content # Publish the page # You will see that the macro will display $body insted of just leave it empty. h3. Expected Results The page should display nothing. h3. Actual Results The page displays "$body". h3. Notes * Every time when adding the user macro into the page, we can see that Confluence add the following before the actual macro into the page source code: {code}


{code} * When we delete this macro when editing a page, Confluence deletes the actual macro HTML tags, but keeps that first part h3. Workaround * Edit the page source code (using the source code editor plugin for example), and remove that part that is left behind when deleting the macro: {code}


{code}
fields.summary: When removing inner nested user macro, some html tags are left behind

fields.description:
When coping indented notes from word, outlook, or any text editor the formatting is not being carried over into Confluence.


h3. Issue Summary

When users are taking notes locally in a notepad, word, outlook for example When a bullet "unindents" more than one level, Confluence misses that. Not only does this put that bullet at the wrong level, it also means all later bullets are shifted by one level. Add this up over a long series of meeting notes, and the end result looks very little like the original. I have attached a picture showing the issue. Note the indent level of the last line "Back to First level". In Word, it really is back to the far left, however in Confluence it is actually at the Second level.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample word doc, or text with indents
 # Create table in any supported browser and paste the content into confluence 

h3. Expected Results
Indents should be properly formatted

h3. Actual Results
Indents are shifted over one level


h3. Workaround

NO workaround available seems to happen consistently across all supported browsers.
fields.summary: When coping indented notes from word, outlook, or any text editor the formatting is not being carried over into Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Previewing the resolved comments will not show the scroll bar. The scroll bar is only shown when you scroll it down and up. That can confuse the users.

To reproduce:

* Create around of 4 to 10 resolved comments.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the scroll bar always visible.

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround for the scroll bar, only the designed behavior.
fields.summary: Make the scroll visible for the Resolved Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Since Confluence 7.3.1, potentially from 7+ there has been a change to the HTML markup of the page tree expand/collapse action where a HREF=undefined instead of the context path or #. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a paraent page and some children # View the source code of the page # Search for the word undefined. h3. Expected Results This is an example from 6.15.7: {code:html}
A
{code} h3. Actual Results This is an example from 7.3.1: {code:html}
A
{code} * *href="undefined?src=contextnavpagetreemode"* undefined is the problem h4. Notes This can cause alerts with monitoring tools such as SiteImprove. From what I can tell, first *href* reference should be blank but we appear to be duplicating the next href, but without the context path. h3. Workaround No known workaround. One will be provided if found in the future.
fields.summary: Expand/collapse action for page tree child pages references an undefined HREF value.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Generating a PDF export of a large space can cause an OutOfMemoryError and causing the JVM to crash.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a large space with lots of pages and attachments.
 # Generate a full Space PDF export.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF export process completes without issues after some time.

h3. Actual Results
The process starts consuming JVM memory over time, causing initial slowness then ultimately crashing the JVM due to OutOfMemoryError.

h3. Notes
This behavior can be triggered by any user with the ability to generate space PDF exports and can cause outages in Production environments. Server downtime.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
A few things can be done to prevent the OOME:
# Increase JVM heap size to allow the PDF export process to complete.
# Break down a large Spaces into smaller Spaces.
# Disable PDF exports altogether: [How to disable PDF Export for Pages or Spaces|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-pdf-export-for-pages-or-spaces-711361415.html].
fields.summary: Full Space PDF Export causing OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Table Cell focus is not working if the column contains Date Macro
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Table* in a Confluence Page.
 # Insert a *Date Macro* (using the default Date Picker) in one of the column.
 # Click on the column to point the *focus/cursor* in the column above the Date Macro.

h3. Expected Results
Focus/cursor pointed in the right column.
h3. Actual Results
Focus/cursor still inside the column that contain the Date Macro.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior in *Firefox* Browser. User may use a different browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer) to prevent the issue.
fields.summary: Table Cell focus/cursor is not working if the column contains Date Macro in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Restoring A Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-space-152036.html] with "Build Index" checked will trigger a full site reindex (in the case of a Data Center, on all nodes), which can cause heavy load to the database and filesystem.

h3. Suggested Solution
A space import should trigger an incremental index - newly added content inserted on _journalentries_ table and processed in the normal index queue flush tasks.
fields.summary: As a Confluence admin I want entries from Space Import to be added to the Index Journal Entry instead of triggering a search index rebuild

fields.description:
I am asking you to revisit CONFSERVER-12263. 

It is standard that different levels of indentation of a bullet list (unordered list) have different symbols.

Confluence uses the same, solid bullet for all levels of list indentation. This makes no sense, and it removes an important visual cue.

Please have Confluence use standards by default, and in this case, that means allowing user agents to naturally vary the bullet style per different levels of list hierarchy.
fields.summary: Use standards for differentiating bullet list indentation levels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

white-space in the Confluence pages including a page using include page macro where the included page already has  include page macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Page A with include page macro.
 # Create another new page B and use include page macro for including Page A created earlier.
 # Automatically Additional White Space is inserted just beginning of the page

h3. Expected Results

There should not be any white space at the beginning of the page.
h3. Actual Results

There is a white space inserted at the beginning of the page.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence Mobile APP is not registering User-Agent as per [RFC documentation|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3], but as {{User-Agent: AtlassianMobileApp}}.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Enable access logs on Confluence.
 - Connect with a Mobile app to Confluence
 - Inspect User-Agent in access logs.

h3. Expected Results

Example:
{code:java}
User-Agent: Confluence/1.9.0 (com.atlassian.confluence.server.app; build:1.9.0.2; iOS 13.3.1) Alamofire/4.9.1 
{code}
h3. Actual Results
{code:java}
User-Agent: AtlassianMobileApp{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

If it seems you are *unable to login* due to this issue, please reach getsupport. It might be symptom of other environment setup issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Image effects do not render on .BMP or animated .GIF files.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a .BMP or .GIF file on a new page. (Example attached.)
 # Click on the image and click Properties.
 # Click on an image effect.

h3. Expected Results

The image effect is applied to the image.
h3. Actual Results

There are no image effects applied.
h3. Workaround

Convert the image to a .png or .jpg.
fields.summary: Image Effects do not render on .BMP or animated .GIF files

fields.description:
When users create a new space, the space name is a required field. Similarly, on the Space Details page, it's not possible to delete the space name.

However, under Space Tools > Configure sidebar, it's possible to delete the space name. This can lead to unexpected behavior (e.g. third-party apps like the Attachment Checker break) and can make it difficult to determine what a certain space is in the space directory.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Create a space
 * Navigate to Space Tools > Configure sidebar
 * Edit space details
 * Delete the space name

h3. Expected results

This should not be allowed
h3. Actual results

Space name is deleted and replaced with an empty string.
fields.summary: Prevent the deletion of space names when configuring sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
To have a standard location for temp files to be created when an attachment is uploaded

h3. Environment
Confluence 7.3.2

h3. Behavior
When a file uploaded via browser upload, the temp file is created in {{<confluence home directory>/temp}}

When a file uploaded via drag and drop, the temp file is created in {{<confluence home directory>/attachment/mod(3 least significant digit in spaceId)/mod(next 3 least significant digit in spaceId)/spaceId/mod(3 least significant digit in pageId)/mod(next 3 least significant digit in pageId)/pageId/contentId/}}

Hence to have all temp files to be created in {{<confluence home directory>/temp}}. This is to standardize the process
fields.summary: Standardize attachment temp file creation directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing one of the dates from recurring event resulting in:
* The event before/after the edited event shift to the edited event
* The recurring event does not change the name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# A weekly recurring event is created.
# The weekly recurring event is created successfully and shown on the calendar as it should.
# Edit one of the event occurrences (either by editing the name or adding the "Who").
# Click OK to save the changes made.
 [^TeamCalendarsTesting.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
* Changes should be applied to all the occurrences of the recurring event.

h3. Actual Results
* Note that the event that is supposed to be a day before/after is shifted to the date of the edited event.
* It may be observed that the events before/after do not respect the changes applied.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing a date of a weekly recurring event, shifts the event a day before/after to the edited date of the recurring event

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have Confluence and Jira on separate appservers and there is a forward proxy *requiring authentication* between the two managing application connection, attempting to add a Gadget Feed XML will cause a generic error and fail to connect. In HTTP logging, this will show HTTP code 407: Proxy authentication required when attempting to make this connection.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Connect Confluence and Jira via application link
# Turn on forward proxy (in an example case Squid was used but Apache can also be leveraged or another proxy)
# Attempt to add a gadget feed XML in Confluence Admin

h3. Expected Results

- You are able to add a Gadget Feed XML or an individual Jira gadget in Confluence

h3. Actual Results

- You get an error instead on the Gadget Feed page in Confluence:

 !image-2020-03-19-15-11-22-774.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior with an outbound proxy enabled. A workaround will be added here when available

You could disable the proxy authentication temporarily, add the Gadget Feed, and then re-enable the proxy. Once the Gadget Feed has been processed, things work normally.
fields.summary: Attempting to add Gadget Feed XML to a Jira site that has a forward proxy causes 407: Authentication header required

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

Should fit within the confines of the column
h3. Actual Results

overlaps into neighboring column
h3. Workaround

This issue does not affect the latest version of firefox 74.0
fields.summary: When inserting the live drop down macro to a table on the last few columns of wide tables get overlapped.

Image previewer on viewrecentblogposts.action doesn't update the image displayed

.* Confluence 6.13.7, 6.15.4, 7.3.2

N/A

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Create new page in Internet Explorer 11
* Paste an image into the editor
* Watch the upload dialog saving the image as attachment
* Press Cmd+Z (MacOS) / Ctrl+Z (Windows or Linux)

Expected result:
* Image is removed

Actually happens:
* Image is still visible, sometimes it gets resized (larger)
* There's a highlighted square in the top left corner of the image and another Cmd+Z/Ctrl+Z is needed to remove it

Notes:
* If saved, the image is not stored on the page
* This may be related to similar bug in other browsers but with different symptom: CONFSERVER-59623
* Collaborative editing does not seem to have any effect on this bug
fields.summary: Image paste undo in IE11 requires two Cmd+Z/Ctrl+Z

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Create new page
* Paste an image into the editor
* Watch the upload dialog saving the image as attachment
* Press Cmd+Z (MacOS) / Ctrl+Z (Windows or Linux)

Expected result:
* Image is removed

Actually happens:
* A block of text with %MCEPASTEBIN% appears in the document and another Cmd+Z/Ctrl+Z is needed to remove it

Notes:
* If saved, this block of text is not stored in the page
* Affects Chrome 79, Firefox 72, Edge 80 (Chromium), Edge 18. In Chrome, the block of text is very narrow and appears to be written vertically. Firefox shows it as regular text.
* Only reproducible when collaborative editing is enabled. It does not affect comments.
fields.summary: %MCEPASTEBIN% shown after undo-ing image past in Chrome/Firefox/Edge/Safari

Changes under "Reorder pages" in Space Tools are not saved after clicking "Undo sorting" after "Sort Alphabetically", the order of the pages will be sorted alphabetically in spite clicking "Undo Sorting"
h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Opening file type that has no app associated with it in Companion App throws error repeatedly

When opening a file type that has no app from local computer associated with, the Companion App throws a meaningful error message but it was thrown 5 times where the user is forced to click the *OK* button repeatedly to dismiss the said error message.

h3. Tested Environment
Confluence 7.3.1
Confluence 7.3.3
Companion App 1.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload an attachment to Confluence 7.3.x where the file type has no app associated with from the local computer
(i) Example: A file that has no filename extension
# Edit the attachment

h3. Expected Results
Companion App should show an error once informing the user of the issue

h3. Actual Results
Although a meaningful error message is shown, but the error box needs to be manually dismissed *5 times*
 [^File Without Extension.mp4] 

Error Message shown:
{code}
This file does not have an app associated with it for performing this action. Please install an app or, if one is already installed, create an association in the Default Apps Settings page.
{code}

h3. Workaround
Manually dismiss the error message for 5 times by clicking the OK button
fields.summary: Opening file type that has no app associated with it in Companion App throws error repeatedly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Saving PowerPoint and Excel file using Edit in Office does not provide a smooth experience

When [Edit in Office|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-edit-in-office-as-a-dark-feature-in-confluence-978217013.html] is enabled in Confluence either via Dark Features(Pre-Confluence7.3) or Admin UI (Confluence 7.3 or above), the PowerPoint and Excel file can be edited locally and have the changes uploaded back to Confluence.
However, the saving experience is not great and can be confusing for user.

h3. Tested Environment
Confluence 7.3.1 / 7.3.3
Microsoft Office 2016

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a PowerPoint or Excel file attachment onto a Confluence page
# Enable *Edit in Office* option according to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/enable-edit-in-office-as-a-dark-feature-in-confluence-978217013.html]
# Edit the PowerPoint and/or Excel file attached on the page

h3. Expected Results
When the user try to save (CTRL+S) their changes, it should be uploaded into Confluence seamlessly

h3. Actual Results
Error messages appear when attempt to save changes and the user has to first *discard changes* and attempt to save it again in order for the save and upload to be successful
 [^Excel - NOT OK.mp4] 
 [^PowerPoint - NOT OK.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
When the attachment is first downloaded and opened in the Excel/PowerPoint locally, first perform a save to trigger the error and choose to _Discard Changes_ then start editing as the subsequence savings will then work correctly.

h3. Note
Word document has no such issue and can be saved correctly on the first go.
 [^Word - OK.mp4]
fields.summary: Saving PowerPoint and Excel file using Edit in Office does not provide a smooth experience

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
java.io.tmpdir has no effect on changing the installation temp directory

In the [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-home-and-other-important-directories-590259707.html#ConfluenceHomeandotherimportantdirectories-Tempdirectory(installationdirectory)] about changing the installation temp directory. It is advised to use the Java parameter below:
{code}
-Djava.io.tmpdir=/path/to/your/own/temp/directory
{code}
In the {{catalina.sh}} and {{catalina.bat}} file, the comment below suggests the same as well:
{code:title=catalina.sh}
#   CATALINA_TMPDIR (Optional) Directory path location of temporary directory
#                   the JVM should use (java.io.tmpdir).  Defaults to
#                   $CATALINA_BASE/temp.
{code}
{code:title=catalina.bat}
rem   CATALINA_TMPDIR (Optional) Directory path location of temporary directory
rem                   the JVM should use (java.io.tmpdir).  Defaults to
rem                   %CATALINA_BASE%\temp.
{code}
However, having this Java parameter set has no effect on changing the installation temp directory

h3. Tested Environment
Confluence 6.15.1
Confluence 7.3.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Stop a vanilla Confluence and [add the system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] below:
{code}
-Djava.io.tmpdir=/somewhere/doesnt/matter 
{code}
# Restart Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The Installation Temp directory will be changed according to the Java parameter included

h3. Actual Results
The Installation Temp directory is not changed despite the Java parameter can be seen to parsed successfully into Confluence:
 !installation temp not respected.png|thumbnail! 
Meanwhile, the original installation temp directory will still be used and a second set of {{java.io.tmpdir}} can be seen

h3. Workaround
Add this line into {{setenv.sh}} according to [the Jira KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-temporary-directory-648545076.html]:
{code:title=setenv.sh}
CATALINA_TMPDIR='/path/to/new/installation/temp'
{code}

h3. Note
The newly changed installation temp directory from the workaround step may not be created by Confluence if it doesn't already exist due to CONFSERVER-59610
fields.summary: java.io.tmpdir has no effect on changing the installation temp directory

fields.description: The Application links plugin used in Atlassian Confluence Server and Data Center before version 6.13.11, and from version 6.14.0 before version 7.3.3 allows remote attackers with administrator privileges to edit existing applinks without passing WebSudo via an improper authorization check. See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1391 for more details.
fields.summary: Improper Authorization in Applinks - CVE-2019-20105

fields.description:
We are taking the inspiration from this link: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/dc-deployments-automation] to automate both server and DC installations of Atlasssian applications. This has worked really well with JIRA but we are having some issues with confluence mainly because of the way information are stored in the file system. JIRA for example does not store the information like server id, license information and cluster details in the dbconfig.xml. Whereas confluence has all those information in the confluence.cfg.xml. 

For that reason, we where able to automate the installation of JIRA server and DC easily. We were also able to automate the installation of confluence server with a special trick to not copy the [confluence.cfg.xml|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/dc-deployments-automation/src/master/roles/confluence_config/templates/confluence.cfg.xml.j2] file on every build of our code. Because a copy of the template without license and server id will assume a fresh install.

When doing the server installation, 
{code:java}
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><confluence-configuration>  <setupStep>setupstart</setupStep>
  <setupType>custom</setupType>
  <buildNumber>0</buildNumber>  <properties>
    <property name="confluence.database.choice">postgresql</property>
    <property name="confluence.database.connection.type">database-type-standard</property>
    <property name="hibernate.dialect">com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect</property>
    <property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">${localHome}/temp</property>
    <property name="attachments.dir">${confluenceHome}/attachments</property>    <property name="hibernate.connection.driver_class">{{ atl_db_driver }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.url">{{ atl_jdbc_url }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.username">{{ atl_jdbc_user }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.password">{{ atl_jdbc_password }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.min_size">{{ atl_db_poolminsize }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_size">{{ atl_db_poolmaxsize }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.timeout">{{ atl_db_timeout }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.idle_test_period">{{ atl_db_idletestperiod }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_statements">{{ atl_db_maxstatements }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.validate">{{ atl_db_validate }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.acquire_increment">{{ atl_db_acquireincrement }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery">select version();</property>  </properties>
</confluence-configuration>{code}
Now applying a variant of that template with DC configurations does not work and causes a crash
{code:java}
<confluence-configuration>  <setupStep>setupstart</setupStep>
  <setupType>custom</setupType>
  <buildNumber>0</buildNumber>  <properties>
    <property name="confluence.database.choice">postgresql</property>
    <property name="confluence.database.connection.type">database-type-standard</property>
    <property name="hibernate.dialect">com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect</property>
    <property name="webwork.multipart.saveDir">${localHome}/temp</property>
    <property name="attachments.dir">${confluenceHome}/attachments</property>    <property name="hibernate.connection.driver_class">{{ atl_db_driver }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.url">{{ atl_jdbc_url }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.username">{{ atl_jdbc_user }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.connection.password">{{ atl_jdbc_password }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.min_size">{{ atl_db_poolminsize }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_size">{{ atl_db_poolmaxsize }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.timeout">{{ atl_db_timeout }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.idle_test_period">{{ atl_db_idletestperiod }}</property>
    <property name="hibernate.c3p0.max_statements">{{ atl_db_maxstatements }}</property>

    <property name="confluence.cluster.name">{{ atl_aws_stack_name }}</property>
    <property name="confluence.cluster.ttl">1</property>  </properties>
</confluence-configuration> {code}
This is the error message we are getting
{noformat}
 com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Spring Application context has not been set at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.getInterruptibly(LazyReference.java:149) at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:112) at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.webwork.ConfluenceXWorkTransactionInterceptor.getTransactionManager(ConfluenceXWorkTransactionInterceptor.java:29) at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XWorkTransactionInterceptor.intercept(XWorkTransactionInterceptor.java:56) at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165) at com.atlassian.confluence.xwork.SetupIncompleteInterceptor.intercept(SetupIncompleteInterceptor.java:52) at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165) at com.atlassian.confluence.security.interceptors.SecurityHeadersInterceptor.intercept(SecurityHeadersInterceptor.java:39) at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165) at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35){noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the case if the Installation Temp directory has not already existed, Confluence failed to re-create the directory during the startup. This might happen if a customer choose to [change the Installation Temp directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-home-and-other-important-directories-590259707.html#ConfluenceHomeandotherimportantdirectories-Tempdirectory(installationdirectory)] to a path that is not already existed.

h3. Tested Environment
* [Confluence 7.3.3|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-7.3.3-x64.bin] (x)
* [Confluence 7.2.0|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-7.2.0-x64.bin] (x)
* [Confluence 7.0.1|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-7.0.1-x64.bin] (/)

(i) The issue seems to have started from Confluence 7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download [Confluence 7.3.3 Linux Installer|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/downloads/binary/atlassian-confluence-7.3.3-x64.bin] and install it
# Go through the setup wizard to have a bare minimum of Confluence up and running
# Stop Confluence
# Remove the {{*<Installation>/temp*}} directory
# Start Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Confluence will re-create the {{*<Installation>/temp*}} directory and startup as usual

h3. Actual Results
Confluence did not re-create the {{*<Installation>/temp*}}, causing the plugins that require to be loaded in this directory to fail on starting. For example Synchrony and the user-installed plugins in the database.

h3. Workaround
Manually create the Installation Temp directory before starting Confluence and ensure that the user running Confluence has full read/write permission to it.

h3. Side Note
The same issue is not observed in the Windows environment
fields.summary: Confluence not able to re-create Installation Temp directory in Linux

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we remove and re-add a user directory global permissions are not updated in case you have "Can Use" permission on a group from an External Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group "test-group" in the external AD
# Add a user "test-user" into this group
# Add and synchronise the directory
# Give "test-group" global "Can Use" permissions in Confluence
# Give "test-group" any space level permission
# Check in "Inspect Permissions" that the user have permissions to use this space
# Completely remove external directory from "User Directories"
# Then add it again
# Synchronise, but do not change the order
# Go to "Inspect Permissions" and check the permissions of "test-user"

h3. Expected Results
# The user should have permissions to use the space, because "test-group" still has global and space permissions

h3. Actual Results
# Inspect Permissions shows that user does not have "Can Use" permissions

h3. Workaround
# Option 1: Changing external directories will triggers cache update, and "Inspect Permissions" will pick up permissions correctly
# Option 2: Disabling/enabling the Gatekeeper app will force an update on the cache and you will see the proper permissions for "test-user"
fields.summary: Removing and re-adding a user directory with global permissions on an external group will lead to incorrect user's permissions on the "Inspect Permissions" page
Update Confluence DC documentation to make a generic port reference

h3. Issue Summary

Copying and pasting links to pages in edit mode converts URL from HTTPS to HTTP in edit mode, but once the page is saved, the URL is updated to HTTPS. 

This causes a problem when trying to use "Go to link" button with the pasted link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Confluence with SSL connector
 # Create a page and insert a link to another page then save
 # edit the page and copy the link from previous step and paste it in a new line
 # Hover over the pasted link and click on "Go to link" 

h3. Expected Results

The pasted URL should be exactly the same as the copied one "HTTPS"
h3. Actual Results

The pasted URL changes to HTTP
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying and pasting page links causes links to change from HTTPS to HTTP in edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving text from one cell to another, Confluence does not recognise the changes as "Removed/Added", instead it is highlighting it as "Formatting was changed" which makes it difficult to identify the changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert a table
 # Add text "x" to cells under the first column
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page >> remove the "x" from first column, add "x" text to the cells under second column
 # Compare the two versions in page history

h3. Expected Results

When comparing, the removed text should be highlighted in red and marked as "This line was removed." and text under second column should be highlighted in green and marked as "This line was added."
h3. Actual Results

When comparing pages, the removed "x" text is not visible nor highlighted in red, 
 and text under second column is highlighted as "Formatting was changed."
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page history comparison does not recognise changes in tables when the text is moved from one cell to another

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When comparing two versions of a page with changes in tables, the format of the table is not showing as expected, instead it is showing the modified cells out of the table (see screenshots).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert a table
 # Add text inside table cells
 # Publish the page
 # Edit the page >> Remove text from some table cells >> Publish the page
 # Go to Page history >> Compare the two versions

h3. Expected Results

When comparing the two versions in the scenario above, the format of the table should remain the same and removed text should be highlighted in red inside the table not outside it
h3. Actual Results

When comparing the two versions in the scenario above, the format is not correct, the table cells are moved out of the table
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page history comparison not showing table format correctly when there is a difference in table's content

fields.description:
+As a+ system admin
+I want+ Confluence to send notifications in bulk
+So that+ E-Mail servers are not overloaded with lots of individual e-mails, one for each update for each recipient, whenever a page gets updated.

h3. Problem Definition
Customers may face e-mail storms from Confluence due to notifications being sent for pages and blogs watched.
As Confluence generates one individual e-mail for each user, this can escalate to several users being notified for several pages, causing a heavy load on e-mail servers.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bulk e-mail notifications so that instead of one message per user, it could send one message for the total watchers or grouping them for configurable number if the watcher list is large, for instance, one message for each 30 watchers. (BCC them?)

h3. Workaround
None at the moment, but you can consider:
* Reducing the events notified:
[How to globally disable e-mail notifications with page content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-globally-disable-e-mail-notifications-with-page-content-718670714.html]
* Increasing the time for batching e-mails:
[Email Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html?_ga=2.217851798.1001520385.1583151685-296208751.1582325698]
fields.summary: Bulk instead of individual e-mails from Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to search content in Office 2003 files (*.docx, *.xlsx, *.ppt) when their sizes exceed certain thresholds:
||Extension||Threshold||
|DOCX|16 MB|
|XLSX|512 KB|
|PPTX|512 KB|
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Attach a 2003 Office document that is larger than the threshold for its type eg. PPTX file larger than 512 KB

h3. Expected Results

Content of the document is returned in the search results
h3. Actual Results

Content of the document is not returned in the search results
h3. Workaround

You can increase the threshold (in bytes) for a particular extension by setting a corresponding Java sysprop and restarting Confluence. List of acceptable sysprops can be found below:
||Extension||Sysprop key||Sysprop value||
|DOCX|officeconnector.textextract.word.docxmaxsize|Max file size|
|XLSX|officeconnector.excel.extractor.maxlength|Max file size x 2|
|PPTX|officeconnector.powerpoint.extractor.maxlength|Max file size x 2|

eg. if you want Confluence to index PPTX files up to 100 MB, set this sysprop:
{code:java}
-Dofficeconnector.powerpoint.extractor.maxlength=209715200{code}
h3. Notes
 * Indexing large documents may consume a lot of memory and cause Confluence to OOME. You may need to increase heap size according to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/file-conversion-service-causes-out-of-memory-errors-in-confluence-5-7-or-above-703398523.html]  
 * Newly set thresholds are applied to files uploaded from that time going forward. You may need to re-upload files for Confluence to re-index if they failed before the new thresholds are set.

 
{panel:title=Update 11/03/2021}
{color:#0747a6}Name, description and workaround of this bug were updated to reflect its proper root cause.{color}
{panel}
fields.summary: Unable to search content in Office 2003 files when their sizes exceed certain thresholds

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During a group deletion, Confluence retrieves all space permissions (for each space) from DB, and then filters them by that group. 
 Eventually, it means that Confluence loads permissions for all spaces from DB. 
 In the case of a Data Center instance, it takes even longer because all this information is loaded to the distributed cache.
 In broad terms, that explains why it may take so much time to confirm the deletion of a group: Confluence is calculating space permissions prior to the deletion. Screenshot below.
 The deletion itself is pretty fast. But depending on the number of spaces and groups an environment has, the space permissions calculations can take from several seconds to several minutes.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


*Environment*

Observed in these versions:
 * Confluence 6.13.4, 6.13.6, but this is also observable in any 6.x versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1 (single space/group)*
 # install a vanilla instance
 # create a sample space, named SpaceA
 # create a sample group, named GroupA
 # create space permission in SpaceA related to GroupA
 # flush Cache to ensure data will be loaded from DB
 # now go to *Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Groups*
 # delete GroupA
 ** it will show a confirmation screen, loading all the spaces permissions that are related to this group
 ** this time will load pretty fast because there are just one space and one group
 ** in a controlled test, this scenario took 600ms to complete
 # cancel the deletion

*Scenario 2 (multiple spaces / single group)*
 This is not a real scenario but we tested it to illustrate an increase in complexity. 
 However, it's still far from a customer real environment due to scalability (customers tend to have thousands of spaces/groups instead of hundreds)
 # install a vanilla instance
 # create 100 spaces, named Space1 \{2,3,4 etc}
 # create a sample group, named Group1
 # create space permission in each Space(N) related to Group1
 # flush Cache to ensure data will be loaded from DB
 # now go to *Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Groups*
 # delete Group1
 ** it will show a confirmation screen, loading all the spaces permissions that are related to this group
 ** this time it may take a little longer due to space permissions calculations showing the behavior
 ** in a controlled test, this scenario took 2.1 secs to complete
 # cancel the deletion

h3. Expected Results
 * Scenario 2
 ** The group deletion confirmation screen to load without any further delay.

h3. Actual Results
 * Scenario 2
 ** The group deletion confirmation screen took a longer time than Scenario 1 due to space permissions calculations.
 (!) This only gets worse the more spaces/groups you add to the scenario (we tested 100 spaces related to 100 groups and it took around 4.5 seconds)
 In a real situation with a prod environment from a customer, ~6600 groups related to ~790 spaces, it takes +2 minutes to complete the space permissions calculations.

h3. Workaround

Since the problem lies in the space permissions calculations, you can bypass it and go straight to the actual group deletion action, using the RPC-API SOAP call. 
 Example below.
 For reference: [Confluence XML RPC and SOAP APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis/]
{code:bash}
#!/bin/bash

ADMIN_USRNAME=<adminuser>
ADMIN_USRPWD=<adminpwd>
CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL="http://<host>/confluence"
GROUP_NAME=<group_name>
API_METHOD=removeGroup

echo "Deleting group ${GROUP_NAME} ..."
curl \
    --user $ADMIN_USRNAME:$ADMIN_USRPWD \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    -H "Accept: application/json" \
    -X POST \
    -d '{ "jsonrpc" : "2.0", "method" : "'${API_METHOD}'", "params" : ["'${GROUP_NAME}'", ""], "id": 7 }' \
    ${CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL}/rpc/json-rpc/confluenceservice-v2?os_authType=basic 2>/dev/null | jq -r '.'
{code}
fields.summary: Deleting a group may take a long time due to Space permissions calculations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user is visiting a Blog Post in confluence. There are 3 different options to _Watch_ the *Blog* content in a Space:
# Watch blog post
# Watch for new blog posts in this space
# Watch all content in this space
 !Watch Blog.png|thumbnail! 

These options are self-explanatory and have been further explained in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs-139579.html]

However, when the user is visiting the _Recent Blog Posts_ page from the sidebar, the user is presented with "Watch this Blog" button which can be misleading (refer to the _Misleading Button_ section below)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create multiple Blog Posts in a Space and publish it
# Click on the "Blog" option on the left pane and user will be brought to a list of _Recent Blog Posts_
# Click on the "Watch This Blog" option on the top right
 !Watch This Blog.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Misleading Button
A *Watch this Blog* button shown in this page can mislead user to believe this is a button to *Watch Every Blog* in the space, or at least the list of blogs that are shown in this page.

In fact, this button functions as the same with the "Watch for new blog posts in this space" option that is described earlier. By clicking on this option, the user will only receive notification from any new blog posts but not from any pre-existing post update
 !Watch Compare.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Change this to an option to "Watch All Blog Posts" in the space; Or
* Rename the button to something less misleading such as "Watch for new blog posts"
fields.summary: "Watch This Blog" button in Recent Blog list is misleading

Username with only '안현' supposed to be in the result first followed by the others that has part of '안현', or display all results inclusive of the '안현'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Page properties report" works fine if its inside either a "Panel" macro or an "Expand" macro but "Page properties report" does not works as expected if it's placed within the merger of both "Panel" or "Expand" macros. The expand macro in a panel macro creates a second html thead-tag.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with 'Page properties' macro
 # Add a table inside the 'page properties' macro as mentioned in [Page Properties Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-properties-macro-184550024.html]
 # Add a Label to the page and publish the page.
 # Copy the page and create multiple copies of the page with different page title on the same space.
 # Create a new page on the same space.
 # Add a 'Panel' macro.
 # Inisde the 'Panel' macro add a 'Expand' macro.
 # Inide the 'Expand' macro add "Page properties report' macro
 # Add the same Label name which was created on step 3 under 'Label' and under 'In space'  mention current space.
 # Save  and Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

Screenshot attached : ExpectedResults
 The first row of the Page Macro displays properly.
h3. Actual Results

Screenshot attached : ActualResults
 The first row of the Page Macro displays abnormally taking the backgroud color as set for the panel macro. 
 Upon looking at the html, we see two thead tags as per below attached screenshot. 
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-10 at 8.16.12 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 'Page properties report' macro does not works as expected if it's placed within the merger of both 'Panel or 'Expand' macros.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since the linking to anchor jumping does not take into consideration the page operation menu bar, the first 2 lines after the anchor macro will be hidden by the menu bar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that contains a minimum content of 2 paginations. 
 # Add an anchor macro in the middle of the page and add 1 line of text after the macro. 
 # Add a link to the anchor at the beginning of the page. 
 # Save the page and click on the anchor macro

h3. Expected Results
It should jump to the anchor position and show the line of text after the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The line of the text is hidden by the page operation menu.
!Screenshot 2020-03-06 at 10.54.08.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Add 2 new brake lines between the anchor macro and the text.
fields.summary: The first line of text after anchor macro is not showing after the linking jump

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When running a full or incremental remote directory synchronization, the changes pulled in from that remote directory are not reflected in Gatekeeper.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an external user directory
# Synchronize the users and groups from there
# Go to Inspect Permissions
# Set some permissions for a group (i.e. *_groupA_*)
# Make some changes in the remote directory (such as update the group name to *_groupA1_*)
# Now go back to User Directories
# Disable that directory, click Synchronize (this will force a full sync when we enable it again)
# Enable it again and click Synchronize

h3. Expected Results
The changes in the remote directory should be reflected in Confluence as well as in Gatekeeper. The group name should be updated and carry the permissions set on the old name


h3. Actual Results
New group with new no permissions set.
(!) If we rename this group to the same one as before, those permissions will appear again

h3. Workaround
The system administrator can disable and then enable the plugin to force a refresh of the user cache
fields.summary: GroupUpdatedEvent is not taken into account by Gatekeeper

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a new user from an external user directory (connector), any status updates to this user (enabled/disabled) will not be picked up by Gatekeeper. Confluence will show this user as disabled. In Inspect Permissions, when you check the checkbox "Don't show disabled user accounts" Gatekeeper still shows the disabled user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in an LDAP/AD (Active Directory)
# Synchronize the Active Directory
# Make sure that this user is visible in Inspect Permissions
# Disable that user in LDAP/AD
# Synchronize the Active Directory
# In Confluence, this user will show as disabled
# Go to Inspect Permissions, check the checkbox "Don't show disabled user accounts"

h3. Expected Results
The disabled users won't appear in the list

h3. Actual Results
Users are still loaded in that list even though they are disabled

h3. Workaround
Disable the Gatekeeper plugin and enable it again for this to work and any subsequent status updates
fields.summary: Gatekeeper will ignore status updates (enabled/disabled) on newly added users from an external directory

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When task report macro is sorted by user name ("assignee"), a new join is added to SQL query:
{code:java}
left join cwd_user cu on um.username = cu.user_name {code}
As both um.username and cu.user_name do not have indexes, the database has to scan tables (it leads to performance degradation).

Full SQL query statement:
{code:java}
SELECT DISTINCT t.GLOBAL_ID, t.CONTENT_ID,CASE WHEN cu.lower_display_name IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE 1 END CU_LOWER_DISPLAY_NAME,
cu.lower_display_name,t.CREATE_DATE
FROM AO_BAF3AA_AOINLINE_TASK t
JOIN CONTENT c ON t.CONTENT_ID = c.CONTENTID
JOIN SPACES s ON c.SPACEID = s.SPACEID
LEFT JOIN user_mapping um ON t.ASSIGNEE_USER_KEY = um.user_key
LEFT JOIN cwd_user cu on um.username = cu.user_name
WHERE s.SPACESTATUS <> 'ARCHIVED' AND c.CONTENT_STATUS <> 'deleted' AND t.TASK_STATUS = 'UNCHECKED'
ORDER BY CU_LOWER_DISPLAY_NAME DESC , cu.lower_display_name ASC , t.CREATE_DATE DESC;  {code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare a Confluence instance with a lot of inline tasks and pages
 # Create a page and add a task report macro sorted by "assignee"
 # Enable SQL logging in Confluence
 # Open a page with task report macro
 # Retrieve the SQL query from logs and check its execution plan (by using DB tools)

h3. Expected Results

SQL query does not perform full scan on cwd_user and user_mapping tables
h3. Actual Results

SQL query performs full scan on either cwd_user or user_mapping tables (or both)
h3. Workaround

Do not sort tasks by "assignee".
fields.summary: Task report macro uses "username" fields to join tables (instead of lower_username)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you disable an external user directory, Gatekeeper should not show the users and groups coming from that user directory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an external user directory
# Synchronize the users and groups from there
# Go to Inspect Permissions
# You should see the list of new users and groups there (In the case of a delegated user directory, once a user logs in)
# Now go back to User Directories
# Disable that directory

h3. Expected Results
Those users and groups shouldn't show in the Inspect Users and Groups list

h3. Actual Results
Those users and groups are still in that list and Gatekeeper displays the following message _The explanation for this permission could not be found_
 !gatekeeper-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to do the following:
# Remove the user directory
# Enable and Disable the Gatekeeper plugin
fields.summary: Gatekeeper will still load users and groups from a user directory that is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an existing user directory is removed, Gatekeeper is not aware of it and does not update its user cache.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an external user directory
# Synchronize the users and groups from there
# Go to Inspect Permissions
# You should see the list of new users there
# Now go back to User Directories
# Disable and Remove that directory

h3. Expected Results
Those users shouldn't show in the Inspect Users list


h3. Actual Results
Those users are still in that list

h3. Notes
ApplicationDirectoryRemovedEvent is sent when the user directory is removed

h3. Workaround
The system administrator can disable and then enable the plugin to force a refresh of the user cache
fields.summary: ApplicationDirectoryRemovedEvent is not taken into account by Gatekeeper

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When we click on the "like" or "stop watching page" buttons on the email notifications that were received more than 7 days ago, we are redirected to an HTTP 401 error page.
h3. Environment

Confluence Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User A watches a page
 # User B makes changes to the content on this page
 # User A gets notified via email
 # After 7 days, User A clicks on either the "like" or "stop watching page" buttons on the email and gets redirected to 401 unauthorized error

h3. Expected Results

The "like" and "stop watching page" buttons should not expire
h3. Actual Results

The "like" and "stop watching page" buttons expire after 7 days.
h3. Workaround

Click on "View Page" from the email and like or stop watching page from the Confluence UI.
h3. Notes
A URL to the "Like" button in email notification look something like below:
{code}
http://localhost:27121/c7121/plugins/likes/like.action?contentId=1212419&src=mail&src.mail.product=confluence-server&src.mail.timestamp=1623725920074&src.mail.notification=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-mentions-plugin%3Amention-created-notification&src.mail.recipient=ff80808179d47d590179d47dd9a50000&src.mail.action=like&jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWIiOiJ4c3JmOmZmODA4MDgxNzlkNDdkNTkwMTc5ZDQ3ZGQ5YTUwMDAwIiwicXNoIjoiNzAyZjBmZDQwMTBiY2MwMjQ0YTE2ZWRkMGViNmM4NjIzNGE5MGUxYjA3NzYxYjRkYmQzMGY1ZDFmMzEzZjBhNyIsImlzcyI6ImNvbmZsdWVuY2Vfbm90aWZpY2F0aW9uc0IyQ0ktRDhCQy02MU80LVowOUEiLCJleHAiOjE2MjQzMzA3MjAsImlhdCI6MTYyMzcyNTkyMH0.M4OBSgFiSR_IA7_5VD3Vrr54zp0a5m0Y2w9nRypsJuo
{code}
We can see there is a timestamp in part of the URL {{*src.mail.timestamp=1623725920074*}} and the value can be converted using an [Epoch Converter|https://www.epochconverter.com/] to see when is the email generated. 

Manually setting this value to a date older than 7 days can easily replicate this issue as a proof of concept
fields.summary: Like and Stop Watching page options from email notification has an expiration

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When migrating from Cloud to Server, the data listed in the Contributors macro doesn't match. 

Either the data for the Contributors macro is not migrated to Server or the Contributors macro compiles different data. 

The query below is the data used by the Server Contributors macro:
{code:java}
SELECT c.title, 
       u.username  AS Creator, 
       c.creationdate, 
       c.lastmoddate, 
       um.username AS LastModifier
FROM   content c 
       JOIN user_mapping u 
         ON c.creator = u.user_key 
       JOIN user_mapping um 
         ON c.lastmodifier = um.user_key 
WHERE  c.prevver IS NULL 
       AND c.contenttype = 'PAGE' 
       AND c.content_status = 'current'; 
{code}
The Server query returns the username or email account for creators. 
if the query is ran against the Cloud DB, the creator using Atlassian Account ID. 

h3. Solution

h4. Option
Update the documentation to inform the admin that after migrating from Cloud to Server,  the returned results from the *Contributors* macro may not coincide. 
h4. Option
Resolve the discrepancy between the data returned in the Cloud and Server *Contributors* macro.
fields.summary: Consideration made for the Contributors macro when migrating from Cloud to Server

h3. Issue Summary:

In our public document is not clear who are authorised to *Delete a page hierarchy :* 
[Delete or Restore a Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf72/delete-or-restore-a-page-982322679.html] 
h3. Expected Results

In one of our internal testing notes, we have the following:
{quote}A user who only has Delete Own permission in a space is not allowed to delete hierarchies. The only people who are allowed to delete hierarchies are *Space Admin, System Admins, and people with explicit Delete Page permission in the space*.
{quote}
However this information in not available in our public documents.

Actual Results :

As above information is not available in our public documents. 
 So it is not clear for our users, who is authorised to 'Delete a page hierarchy'.

Having said that, I'd suggest, If we could include this information in [Delete and restore page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf72/delete-or-restore-a-page-982322679.html] .
fields.summary: Missing information on Delete or Restore a Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing the REST API endpoints as an unauthenticated user an error page is displayed and this page contains the version information for Tomcat. This is a security concern and should not be disclosed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an unauthenticated user access the following REST endpoint:
 ** http(s)://<your-conflunece-url>/rest/menu/latest/admin

h3. Expected Results
 * Error is displayed but the Tomcat version information is hidden.

h3. Actual Results
 * Error is displayed as well as the Tomcat version details as per the screen-shot below:
 !image-2020-03-04-15-09-34-969.png!

h3. Workaround

Alter the behavior of the error reporting by adding the following entry to your server.xml file:
{code:java}
<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve" showReport="true" showServerInfo="false"/>{code}
This will suppress the server information being displayed as part of the error report.
fields.summary: Tomcat version information disclosed when calling REST endpoints

fields.description:
Currently, it is not recommended to update the JDBC drivers for Microsoft SQL in Confluence as new driver versions are not yet tested and it is unknown what issues might occur when using a different driver version. Based on the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-jdbc-drivers-171742.html], it is recommended to use the bundled Type 4 JDBC driver since it is the driver version that has been tested with Confluence. 

As an example faced by a user, updating the JDBC driver version causes Confluence to not start up with the new JDBC driver because Windows authentication to the SQL Server is not working. However, it is possible to start Confluence with the new version when the {{.dll}} was renamed to the old name as {{sqljdbc_auth.dll}}. In regards to this, it may be seen that Confluence only recognizes the old naming of the {{.dll}} file. Confluence should be able to recognize the {{.dll}} file that is stored in {{<confluence-install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}} without the change of the naming.

As a suggestion, Confluence should be able to support the newer version of JDBC drivers.
fields.summary: Ability to update JDBC drivers for Microsoft SQL Server Authentication

fields.description:
If one node crashes on DC setup, user-session information stored on that node will be gone, and the user will need to authenticate again.

The solution for this is to use SSO or remember me cookie functionality, but they will also show invalid session:
 !4AAF218.png|thumbnail! 

The user will not need to enter credentials but he will need to reload the page.

It would be a good solution to introduce Redis or some other caching mechanism so that the user login information is not lost if one node crashes. Alternatively, as with the Crowd, we could store session information inside the DB, and the application can retrieve it if there is no information in the cache.
fields.summary: If one node crashes, user session information stored on that node will be gone, and user will need to authenticate again.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Triggering a full Space Export to PDF can cause an OutOfMemoryError (OOME) and crash the Confluence JVM, causing an outage. The export can be triggered accidentally while attempting to run a Custom Space Export to PDF as tracked under CONFSERVER-35540.

h3. Suggested Solution

Requesting to include a Confirmation dialog/prompt under *Space Tools > Content Tools > Export > PDF > Normal Export > Export button*.

The Confirmation dialogue should include a Cancel and Ok button, but also some verbiage to inform the user that a PDF export is a memory-intensive operation, and exporting a large Space (with multiple pages and attachments) can cause slowness and, worst cases, a full outage.

This should be simple enough to implement, and might prevent a few accidental clicks.

h3. Workaround 
# Fix the OOME as tracked under CONFSERVER-55021 and CONFSERVER-59643.
# Include a *Cancel button* during the Space PDF export process - CONFSERVER-45603 reopened due to new interest
fields.summary: Confirm dialog before exporting whole Space as PDF
